dials.label: Fee Aggressiveness
dials.description: How aggressively to charge fees. Higher = more revenue, more complaints.

dials.label: Growth Velocity
dials.description: How aggressively to acquire customers. Higher = more growth, higher acquisition costs.

dials.label: Service Level
dials.description: Quality of customer service. Higher = faster complaint resolution, higher OPEX.

dials.label: Retention Spend
dials.description: Investment in keeping customers. Higher = lower churn, higher OPEX.

dials.label: Compliance Stringency
dials.description: Rigor of compliance processes. Higher = lower regulatory risk, higher OPEX.

constraints.description: Cannot have high growth velocity with low service level (overwhelms staff)
constraints.violation_message: High growth requires adequate service capacity

constraints.description: High fees require high service to manage complaints
constraints.violation_message: Aggressive fees generate complaints that require strong service

constraints.description: Cannot drop compliance below minimum regulatory requirements
High retention spend with high growth is inefficient (spending on both)
constraints.violation_message: High retention + high growth creates cost inefficiency

pressure_messages.fee_aggressiveness_high: The Board is concerned about reputation risk from aggressive fee policies
pressure_messages.fee_aggressiveness_low: The Board questions whether we're leaving revenue on the table
pressure_messages.growth_velocity_high: The Board worries rapid growth will strain operations
pressure_messages.growth_velocity_low: The Board expects stronger customer acquisition numbers
pressure_messages.service_level_high: The Board sees service costs eating into margins
pressure_messages.service_level_low: The Board is concerned about rising complaint rates
pressure_messages.retention_spend_high: The Board questions the ROI on retention investments
pressure_messages.retention_spend_low: The Board is alarmed by rising churn rates
pressure_messages.compliance_stringency_high: The Board views compliance spending as excessive
